instructions: In a large bowl, mix the flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt.
In another bowl, whisk the milk, egg, melted butter, and vanilla extract.
Pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and stir until just combined.
Heat a non-stick skillet over medium heat and lightly grease it with butter or oil.
Pour 1/4 cup of batter onto the skillet for each pancake.
Cook until bubbles form on the surface and the edges look dry, then flip and cook until golden brown on the other side.
Serve warm with your favorite toppings.
Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add chopped onion, minced garlic, grated carrot, and chopped celery. Cook until vegetables are softened.
Add ground beef to the skillet and cook until browned.
Stir in tomato paste, canned tomatoes, red wine, and beef broth. Bring to a simmer.
Reduce heat and let the sauce simmer for about 30 minutes, or until thickened and the flavors have melded together.
Season with salt and black pepper to taste.
Stir in fresh basil leaves just before serving.
Serve the Bolognese sauce over cooked spaghetti pasta, garnished with grated Parmesan cheese.
In a large pot, heat vegetable oil over medium heat. Add diced onion, minced garlic, and minced ginger. Cook until fragrant.
Add curry powder, turmeric powder, cumin powder, and coriander powder to the pot. Stir well to coat the onions and garlic with the spices.
Add diced potatoes, sliced carrots, and cauliflower florets to the pot. Stir to combine with the spices.
Pour in canned tomatoes and coconut milk. Stir well.
Bring the curry to a simmer and cook until the vegetables are tender.
Stir in peas and cook for an additional 5 minutes.
Season with salt to taste.
Garnish with chopped fresh cilantro before serving.
Serve hot with rice or naan bread.
In a large pot, bring chicken broth to a boil.
Add sliced lemongrass, kaffir lime leaves, and galangal to the broth. Simmer for 10 minutes to infuse the flavors.
Add sliced mushrooms and diced tomatoes to the pot. Cook until the mushrooms are tender.
Stir in fish sauce and lime juice.
Add shrimp to the pot and cook until they are pink and opaque.
Remove the pot from heat and stir in crushed Thai chili peppers.
Garnish with chopped cilantro before serving.
Serve hot and enjoy the spicy and tangy flavors of Tom Yum Soup.
Cook rice noodles according to package instructions. Drain and set aside.
In a small bowl, mix tamarind paste, fish sauce, soy sauce, and brown sugar to make the Pad Thai sauce.
In a large skillet, heat vegetable oil over medium heat. Add minced garlic and cook until fragrant.
Add cooked shrimp or chicken to the skillet and stir-fry for a few minutes.
Push the shrimp or chicken to one side of the skillet and crack eggs into the empty side. Scramble the eggs until cooked, then mix with the shrimp or chicken.
Add cooked rice noodles to the skillet and pour the Pad Thai sauce over the top. Toss well to coat the noodles with the sauce.
Stir in bean sprouts and chopped green onions. Cook for another minute.
Serve Pad Thai with crushed peanuts and lime wedges on the side.
In a bowl, mix yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, garam masala, turmeric powder, chili powder, and salt. Add cubed chicken breast and marinate for at least 1 hour.
In a large skillet, melt butter over medium heat. Add marinated chicken and cook until browned and cooked through.
Remove the chicken from the skillet and set aside.
In the same skillet, add more butter if needed. Add tomato puree and cook until the oil separates from the tomato.
Stir in heavy cream and bring to a simmer.
Return the cooked chicken to the skillet and stir to coat it with the sauce. Cook for another 5 minutes.
Garnish with chopped fresh cilantro before serving.
Serve hot with rice or naan bread.
In a large paella pan or skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add chicken thighs and cook until browned on all sides. Remove and set aside.
Add sliced chorizo sausage to the pan and cook until browned. Remove and set aside with the chicken.
In the same pan, add chopped onion, minced garlic, and chopped bell peppers. Cook until the vegetables are softened.
Stir in diced tomatoes, saffron threads, and paprika. Cook for a few minutes.
Add rice to the pan and stir to coat it with the tomato mixture.
Pour in chicken broth and bring to a simmer.
Return the chicken and chorizo to the pan. Arrange them on top of the rice.
Cook until the rice is tender and has absorbed most of the liquid.
Stir in frozen peas and cook for another 5 minutes.
Garnish with lemon wedges and chopped fresh parsley before serving.
Serve hot and enjoy the flavors of Spain.
Cook sushi rice according to package instructions and let it cool to room temperature.
Place a sheet of nori on a bamboo sushi mat.
Spread a thin layer of sushi rice over the nori, leaving a small border at the top.
Arrange slices of fresh fish, julienned cucumber, and sliced avocado along the bottom edge of the rice.
Using the bamboo mat, roll the sushi tightly from the bottom, applying gentle pressure to shape the roll.
Moisten the top border of the nori with water to seal the roll.
Slice the roll into bite-sized pieces using a sharp knife.
Serve sushi rolls with soy sauce, pickled ginger, and wasabi on the side.
In a skillet, heat the cooked shredded chicken over medium heat.
Add taco seasoning to the chicken and stir well to coat. Cook until the chicken is heated through.
Warm tortillas in a separate skillet or microwave.
Assemble the tacos by placing seasoned chicken in the center of each tortilla.
Top with shredded lettuce, diced tomato, shredded cheddar cheese, sour cream, and salsa.
Serve hot and enjoy the delicious flavors of chicken tacos.
In a large pot, melt butter over medium heat. Add thinly sliced onions and cook until caramelized, about 30 minutes.
Add minced garlic and cook for another minute.
Pour in beef broth and add thyme and a bay leaf. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 20 minutes.
Season with salt and black pepper to taste.
Remove the bay leaf before serving.
Ladle the soup into oven-safe bowls. Top each bowl with a slice of baguette and grated Gruyere cheese.
Place the bowls under the broiler until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
Serve hot and enjoy the rich, savory flavors of French Onion Soup.
Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
In a large bowl, combine peeled and sliced apples, sugar, cinnamon, nutmeg, and lemon juice. Toss to coat the apples evenly.
Place one pie crust in a pie dish. Fill with the apple mixture and dot with small pieces of butter.
Cover with the second pie crust, sealing the edges and cutting small slits in the top to allow steam to escape.
Brush the top crust with egg wash for a golden finish.
Bake in the preheated oven for 50-60 minutes, or until the crust is golden brown and the apples are tender.
Allow the pie to cool before serving.
Serve warm with vanilla ice cream or whipped cream.
In a large bowl, combine chopped cucumber, chopped tomatoes, thinly sliced red onion, chopped green bell pepper, and Kalamata olives.
Add crumbled feta cheese to the bowl.
In a small bowl, whisk together olive oil, red wine vinegar, dried oregano, salt, and black pepper to make the dressing.
Pour the dressing over the salad and toss gently to combine.
Serve immediately or refrigerate for 30 minutes to allow the flavors to meld.
Enjoy the fresh and vibrant flavors of Greek Salad.
Cook fettuccine pasta according to package instructions. Drain and set aside.
In a large skillet, melt butter over medium heat. Add minced garlic and cook until fragrant.
Pour in heavy cream and bring to a simmer.
Stir in grated Parmesan cheese and cook until the sauce has thickened.
Add cooked and sliced chicken breast to the skillet and stir to coat with the sauce.
Season with salt and black pepper to taste.
Toss the cooked fettuccine pasta with the Alfredo sauce until well coated.
Garnish with chopped fresh parsley before serving.
Serve hot and enjoy the creamy goodness of Chicken Alfredo.
Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
In a large bowl, cream together butter, white sugar, and brown sugar until smooth.
Beat in vanilla extract and eggs one at a time.
Dissolve baking soda in hot water and add to the mixture along with salt.
Stir in all-purpose flour and chocolate chips until well combined.
Drop spoonfuls of dough onto ungreased baking sheets.
Bake in the preheated oven for 10-12 minutes, or until edges are nicely browned.
Allow cookies to cool on the baking sheets for a few minutes before transferring to wire racks to cool completely.
Enjoy the deliciousness of homemade chocolate chip cookies.
In a large bowl, combine chopped romaine lettuce, croutons, and grated Parmesan cheese.
In a small bowl, whisk together Caesar dressing, lemon juice, salt, and black pepper.
Pour the dressing over the salad and toss gently to combine.
Serve immediately and enjoy the classic flavors of Caesar Salad.
In a large skillet, melt butter over medium heat. Add chopped onion and minced garlic, cooking until softened.
Add sliced beef sirloin to the skillet and cook until browned.
Stir in sliced mushrooms and cook until tender.
Sprinkle flour over the beef and mushroom mixture, stirring to coat evenly.
Gradually pour in beef broth, stirring constantly until the sauce thickens.
Reduce heat and stir in sour cream and Dijon mustard. Simmer for a few minutes.
Season with salt and black pepper to taste.
Serve the beef stroganoff over cooked egg noodles.
Garnish with chopped fresh parsley before serving.
Enjoy the rich and creamy flavors of Beef Stroganoff.
In a food processor, combine cooked chickpeas, tahini, lemon juice, minced garlic, olive oil, cumin, and salt.
Blend until smooth, adding water as needed to achieve desired consistency.
Transfer the hummus to a serving bowl and drizzle with additional olive oil.
Serve with pita bread, vegetable sticks, or crackers.
Enjoy the creamy and delicious flavors of homemade hummus.
Cut the Napa cabbage into quarters and remove the core. Cut each quarter into bite-sized pieces.
Place the cabbage in a large bowl and sprinkle with salt. Toss to coat and let it sit for 1-2 hours until the cabbage has wilted.
Rinse the cabbage thoroughly to remove excess salt and drain well.
In a separate bowl, combine julienned carrot, julienned radish, chopped green onions, minced garlic, minced ginger, fish sauce, and Korean red pepper flakes to make the kimchi paste.
Add the drained cabbage to the bowl with the kimchi paste. Mix well to ensure all the cabbage is coated.
Pack the kimchi into a clean jar, pressing down to remove any air bubbles. Leave some space at the top of the jar for fermentation gases.
Seal the jar and let it ferment at room temperature for 1-2 days, then refrigerate.
Kimchi can be enjoyed fresh or after a few days of fermentation.
Heat vegetable oil in a deep fryer or large pot to 350°F (175°C).
Peel and cut potatoes into thick strips. Rinse and pat dry.
Fry the potatoes in batches until golden and crispy. Drain on paper towels and season with salt.
In a bowl, whisk together all-purpose flour, baking powder, and salt. Gradually add sparkling water, stirring until the batter is smooth.
Dip the white fish fillets into the batter, allowing any excess to drip off.
Carefully place the battered fish into the hot oil and fry until golden and cooked through.
Drain the fish on paper towels.
Serve the fish and chips hot with a side of malt vinegar.
Preheat your oven to 325°F (160°C).
In a saucepan, heat heavy cream and the vanilla bean (both the seeds and the pod) until just boiling. Remove from heat and let it steep for 15 minutes.
In a bowl, whisk together egg yolks and sugar until pale and thick.
Remove the vanilla bean pod from the cream and gradually whisk the cream into the egg mixture.
Pour the mixture into ramekins and place them in a baking dish.
Fill the baking dish with hot water until it reaches halfway up the sides of the ramekins.
Bake for 40-45 minutes, or until the custards are set but still slightly jiggly in the center.
Remove from the oven and let cool to room temperature, then refrigerate for at least 2 hours.
Before serving, sprinkle an even layer of brown sugar on top of each custard.
Using a kitchen torch, caramelize the sugar until it forms a crispy top.
Serve immediately and enjoy the creamy and crunchy contrast of Creme Brulee.
